description.narrative: Enhancing entrepreneurship ecosystem in Upper Egypt and empowering youth to drive local economic development through entrepreneurship and MSMEs development.

Enroot is currently implementing and expanding on MASAAR, a demand-driven entrepreneurship program, funded by the Dutch Embassy, addressing Egypt’s most pressing employment challenges, and particularly the lack of decent work opportunities for youth in Upper Egypt. The program supports start-ups and emerging businesses in Upper Egypt to improve and grow their ventures and linking them to markets and extended value chains.

Expected Results: 1.1 Established and capacitated BDS Center and incubator inside Sohag University 1.1 Established and capacitated BDS Center and incubator in Luxor 1.2 Sohag BDS Center supported to operate and act as a business support platform 1.2 Luxor BDS Center supported to operate and act as a business support platform 2.1 Targeted youth have an entrepreneurial mindset and the capacity to develop sound business plans (Total 2 governorates) 2.2 Entrepreneurs and youth-led businesses graduated incubation programs and are able to commercially implement and grow their businesses (Total 2 governorates) 3.1 increased linkages and synergies among stakeholders of the local entrepreneurial ecosystem (Total 2 governorates)
Target Groups: - Women - Youth - Start-ups - SMEs - Supporting Organizations

recipient-country.narrative: MASAAR Program promotes entrepreneurial culture and supports youth-led startups in the governorates of Sohag, Luxor, Qena and Assiut
